Name: La Barca
Description:
From the box:
"A truly classic board game that is as old as Rome.  This game was probably played in the very first Roman tavern.  It has remained an Italian favorite to this day.

Object: Most throws of the dice have a price, and players pay the board until someone throws the lucky combination that wins all.

The games in this series are from our favorite "watering holes" on four different continents.  We are proud to present them to our friends here at home, and have forced ourselves to consume a lot of memorable local brews in the fulfillment of this endeavor."

Players take turns to roll two dice.  Any number other than 7, 2 or 12 requires placing the stake (or stone from the set) on the number rolled on the supplied board.

Roll 2 and take the stakes from 8-12, but place a stake on 2.  Roll a 12 and take the stakes from 2-6, but place a stake on 2.  Roll a 7 and you take ALL the stakes, or place one stake on 7 if the board is empty.

Play continues until agreed, or all but one of the players is out of money (or stones).  A Neapolitan version ignores the rules for 2 and 12, and treats them as any other non-7 roll.

Name: American Trivia Challenge Texas Style
Description: A player or team answers questions about Texas in six categories to collect bars for their flag. The categories are: Americana, Arts & Sciences, Business, Et Cetera, Fun & Games, Government & History, and People, Places & Things. Once their flag is full, they must then answer a question in the category of their opponents' choice to seal the win.

Name: PSL Guide to Wargaming
Description:
This introduction to miniature wargaming includes an introduction and articles by eight different authors on wargaming 10 different historical periods. At the end of each chapter, Quarrie presents rules for that particular period.

The historical periods covered include the following: Ancients, Medieval, Renaissance/17th century, 18th century, Napoleonic, Crimean war, American Civil/Franco-Prussian wars, Colonial warfare, World War I, and World War II.

Name: The Lord of the Rings: Battlefields
Description:
Reiner Knizia gives us a new expansion for the classic The Lord of the Rings board game. Each of the boards from the main game has a corresponding battlefield, and players maneuver heroes and villains on these battlefields to improve their position in the fully integrated main game.

From the ancient ruins of Weathertop to the conflict at the Black Gate of Mordor, the journey of the Fellowship of the Ring is marked with battle. The armies of Sauron are on the march, and unless the courage and faith of the Fellowship can hold, the Shadow will be victorious.

The new Battlefields expansion for Reiner Knizia's acclaimed The Lord of the Rings board game focuses on the deadly combats that the Fellowship must survive on its quest to destroy the One Ring. Now in addition to guiding the Fellowship through its many perils, the players also help to hinder or defeat Sauron's powerful armies, because the farther enemies march on the battlefield board, the more destruction they cause and the closer Sauron comes to recovering the One Ring!

Will Aragorn arrive in time to defend against the Witch King at Weathertop? Will Boromir's courage hold against the savage Uruk-Hai? Will Gimli's axe be enough to withstand a horde of orcs at the Chamber of Mazarbul? Join the fight with the Lord of the Rings: Battlefields expansion.

Contents

    3 double-sided battlefield boards 
    5 Fellowship pieces 
    30 Enemy pieces 
    20 trigger tiles 
    6 Feature cards 
    3 Gandalf cards 


 
Expands:

    The Lord of the Rings
Families: Game: Lord of the Rings (Reiner Knizia's co-op game)

Name: Alles Käse
Description:
The most skillful "cheese-knocker", who lets her mouse hide the most often in the delicious cheese before that mouse is caught by the cat, receives for her successes many pieces of cheese (which act as victory points).

Ages 5-99

Name: Gefahr über Sunnydale
Description: "Gefahr über Sunnydale" (Sunnydale in Danger) is an adventure game based on the television series "Buffy the Vampire Slayer". One player battles as the great master the other players who use 5 of 6 heroes (Buffy, Xander, Willow, Giles, Oz and Riley), each with his own special ability. The great master chooses secretly one of 4 scenarios, which determines amongst other things the boss monster (Master, Spike, Wilkins III or Adam). The game has 2 phases. Phase A is the investigation phase, where the heroes move through the town of Sunnydale to find 5 pieces of evidence about the boss monster while battling hordes of minor monsters. Battles are fought with rolling dice and comparing strength and stamina. When the heroes have found who the opponent is and where he lives, phase B - the confrontation phase- starts, which is played on the backside of the board and consists of one battle between the heroes and the boss monster and his surviving  adjutants.
Families: TV Shows: Buffy the Vampire Slayer

Name: The Honeybee Tree
Description: This game consists of several plastic pieces and a large six sided die with 6 different symbols.  One must roll the die in order to add pieces to his/her tree and things must be added in order in the appropriate places.  There are five different piece types: branch, leaf, blossom, butterfly, and bee.  All have a symbol on the die.  The sixth symbol on the die is a beehive that allows any piece that the roller desires to be placed on the tree.  The winner is the first to successfully construct a tree.

Name: In Other Words
Description:
Object: Be the first team to complete all categories: Movies, Books, Songs, and Saying & Quotations.

In a game with 3 or more teams, to complete a category a team must solve two clues in that category;  if you are playing with only two teams, you must solve three clues per category.  Answers have additional information in parentheses such as the author's or singer's name.

Name: The Earth Dinner
Description:
The Earth Dinner is an animated theme dinner party for all ages, connecting people to their food and the earth -- and each other.

The Earth Dinner uses cards to provoke discussion of our food, where it comes from, and how we experience it.

(Adapted from introduction in game rules.)

Name: Huckepack
Description:
A game similar to Pachisi (or Mensch-ärgere-dich-nicht) but with some difference. You can go on another pawn and the pawn downside must carry your pawn.

Big board, 47 * 47 cm and big wooden pawns.

First edition from 1970.
Also playable:
- Husch ins Körbchen!

Another edition from 1979.
There are two more versions also playable:
- Schlitzohr,
- Schwitzkasten

Name: Surf's Up! Hawaii
Description: The surfing game of Hawaii, hit the beach, catch a wave, keep track of expenses as you travel the beaches of Hawaii. It is an adventure of tall crashing waves and long surfboards.

Name: Super Munchkin 2: The Narrow S Cape
Description:
Publisher's DescriptionThere comes a time in every munchkin's career when he's taken on more than he can handle, bitten off more than he can chew, gotten in over his head. It's time for - the Narrow S Cape.

With 112 cards to enhance your Super Munchkin game, The Narrow S Cape is much more than just this season's favorite fashion accessory! It teems with new villains like the contemptible Cheese Wiz, Gothzilla (with earthquake-causing platform boot action!), and the Ratwoman. And lest you feel overwhelmed by villainy, this expansion also features new items, new Powers and a new Class: the Brain!

Wield the Slide Rule and Power Ring against Sister Blister! Tackle Tackyman with the Trampoline! Endure the Two-Hour Monolog because you were Raised By Armadillos! And flee from Shaenon K. Garrity's fearsome Foot and the unfortunate, mind-controlled Too Much Coffee Man!

Super Munchkin 2 - The Narrow S Cape... the ultimate expansion for the bestselling Munchkin series.

				
				
					OtherPart of the Munchkin series

Name: Baffle Box
Description:
The game contains a plastic board with 6x6 holes in it, 36 marbles, 6 colored pegs and 6 white pegs.

Players try to get rid of their marbles by placing them in the holes in the board. If a player thinks that a row is full of marbles he can challenge the move. The winner of the challenge gets rid of one of his marbles.

When a player has no marbles remaining the round ends.

Name: Hextravaganza
Description:
This game is based on my home town of Hexham, in the 
north-east of England:

At the start of the game players get given a set "business cards" and write down the shop name on the card. the cards are placed back in the deck, the game commences. Players use three "shoppers" to get to the shops on their shopping list(moving 1,2 or 3 spaces in total, like 1 piece moves 1 square and anouther moves 2, in 1 go). If another player lands on your piece they get to move you anywhere on the board. once you have been to all your shops try to get all of your pieces to the stained glass window in the middle of the board.

Name: 30 points
Description: In this game each player has few cards in his hand. By discarding and getting new cards from other players, the players need to be the first to get 30 points in their hand.  But, if they get more then 30 points, they lose.  It's a light game that's very luck dependent.

Name: Trilli-Trilli
Description:
It is spring again. All nests contain already eggs. 16 cards are showing which bird should be on every nest. Only one card at a time is revealed. The player who, after having luck with the die rolling and some tactical dexterity, gets the right bird to the right nest, can keep the card.

The game box contains 16 nests, 16 cards, 4 birds and 1 die.

Name: Queablo
Description:
This game combines a word game with mental arithmetic:
In each round, a magical number is determined with a dice. Open displayed cards show one consonant and one number at a time. Players try to build words with the open cards completed with some vocals. While searching for matching words, they always have to check the cross sum of the used numbers which must match the magical number.

The game comes together with 3 variants. More can be found on the official website.

Name: 40 Barrels of Beer
Description: In the middle there is a board made of 9 cards 3X3. Each player will have always between 2-4 cards in there hand. Players put cards on the board, flipping cards, drawing cards and lying in order to put the card that will make 40 points. It’s a family game that requires  memory and a bit of luck.

Name: The Phantom, Ruler of the Jungle Game
Description:
The Phantom, Ruler of the Jungle, brings peace and safety to the natives. Called "The Ghost Who Walks", he is rarely seen except in time of trouble. Then, as a warning of his constant vigilance, he leaves the mark of his skull ring at the scene. Each player is The Phantom, trying to be the first to reach all of the trouble areas and leave a skull ring mark as a sign of protection.

A plastic skull ring is included.

Name: Transet
Description:
Transet is a chess variant played on a 5x5 grid using 5 pieces: rook, bishop, king, bishop and rook. The goal of the game is to reach the opposite side of the board with one of your pieces. The rook can only move one step straight forward, the bishop one step diagonally forward and the king combines the power of the rook and the bishop.

The game only has 5 rules. A small change in rule 1 or 5 (which determine begin & end conditions) makes that the game can be played with 1, 3, 4 or 5 players. The game is published in different versions, only changing color and artwork.

Name: Dragons' Derby
Description:
Five dragons race around a track.  Players bet on three of the dragons.  Play cards to move your dragons forward and hope that other players also want your dragons to win.

Illustrations by Marino Degano.  Ages 14+.  In the L-Series of games.

Name: Buck Rogers
Description:
This vintage game was a 3-in-1 package: Cosmic Rocket Wars, Search for the Secrets of Atlantis, and Siege of Gigantica. Each was for 2 to 4 players, allowing up to 12 players to be accomodated at once. There are three colorful 16x16" game boards, one for each game. The components also include 40 cards, with black and white illustrations, and 12 wooden playing pieces. Listed as being for ages 8 to adult.

Reportedly offered as a Cream of Wheat premium in addition to being available in stores.

Name: Axis & Allies Enhanced Realism Rules
Description:
This is an expansion for Axis & Allies. It contains revisions to the game rules to make it more realistic in areas such as aircraft range, income, retreats, making new units, etc. Introduces artillery rules, new rules for choosing combat losses, and advanced weapons development. To better match the history and politics of the era, the game also introduces air transports, airborne assaults, sub economic warfare, the Russian-Japanese Non-Aggression Pact, and more.

Expands:

    Axis & Allies

Name: Brumm-Brumm
Description:
Two small cars are on the way home.  The turn arrow determines in each case, whether they drive or must pull into the gas station, in order to fill up.  Naturally, the traffic light must be respected, as in proper traffic.

This is a seizing and sliding game for the smallest children, from which nothing can be lost:  The game pieces are firmly connected to the wooden game board.

AGES 2 YEARS AND UP

Name: Speedybag
Description:
Fast-paced and exciting action game for all ages! As a card is turned on the table, all players reach inside their bags and try to find the object pictured in the card, just by feeling with their fingers. If you are the first to find the correct object, you get the card. The winner is the player who has the most cards at the end of the game!

2006 Nominert til Ã…rets Barnespill - Nominated for Children's Game of the Year, Norway

Name: Nautilus
Description: The game consists of a spiral recessed track, 32 small containers (8 in each of 4 colors) and 16 chips.  The chips are put in half the containers (four per color) and the containers are mixed together so that the locations of the chips are hidden.  The containers are placed in the spiral and players take turns rearranging the containers.  When players move pieces of their own color (or have permission from the owning player) they shake them and listen for the chips.  When four pieces of a color are in a row in the spiral, the player collects the chips contained within.  The first player to find all of his chips wins.  (The complete rules contain a number of additional details.)

Name: Rocket Race
Description: An innovative space game with a real flying rocket! The astronauts are trying to get home from the alien planet but the air from the ground keeps blowing them off the path – the players use the pump to control the air streams. The first one to reach the rocket safely gets to fly home in it!

Name: Clown Around
Description: Squeak your way to victory! This funny clown has a squeaky nose and chunky buttons that need to be placed in the correct ”button holes”. Spin the big spinner and rush to find the correct shaped button in front of you. The first player to fit his/her button in the correct hole and squeak the clown’s nose wins the round.

Name: Sergeants!: Expansion
Description:
From the publisher:

So far the Soviet, German, British and Italian soldiers in the Sergeants: On the Eastern Front game system have had it pretty much to themselves. Oh, there’s a deadly assortment of mortars, flamethrowers and shaped-charge weapons and that nasty German infantry gun, but it has always been the shoulder weapons that settled the issue and decided the outcome of a scenario. SERGEANTS! – Expansion adds U. S. Army and French soldiers to that reliable mix.

Name: Flotter Falter!
Description: A memory game for children in which matching butterfly wings are added to bodies.

Name: Vinspillet
Description: The Idea with "Vinspillet" is that the players in a fun and entertaining way get knowledge about French wine. Players role a die and move on a map of France. The players can buy chateaus when landing on one, if you land on another players chateau you have to pay him/her money buying a cask of wine. Players may trade with each other during the game. At some spots you have to pick up a special event card and do as the card tells you. If you land on a a spot with a question mark you get a question form the pile of question marked cards. If your answer is right you win a number of casks equal to a die roll. The game ends when all chateaus are sold. The winner is the one who has the most capital when having counted money and the value of his/her properties.

Name: Love Game
Description:
This game contains four pieces representing men and four pieces representing women.  Either up to four men chase one ideal woman in hopes of getting dates or four women chase one ideal man.  Players simultaneously set their love-o-meters to indicate movement for either themselves or (by paying a gift chip) the ideal member of the appropriate sex.  Dates lead to heart chips, which can be lost for various reasons.  Landing on the spot with another figure, a die is rolled for a random consequence (losing a turn, losing a heart chip, gaining a heart chip).  When all heart chips are distributed, the player with the most wins.

Illustrations by Mordillo.  Ages 14+.  L-Series of games.

Name: Dick Tracy Detective Game
Description:
A simple children's race game which takes place on a colorful map of the northeast U.S. The board and its spaces are illustrated with characters from the Dick Tracy comic strip.

Components include a game board, four markers, and spinner. Rules are printed inside the box lid.

Name: 007 Underwater Battle from Thunderball
Description:
A rare James Bond themed board game based on the underwater battle sequence from the movie Thunderball - Largo v. James Bond!

The game features some attention getting components. These include colorful plastic scuba swimmer figures on clear plastic pedestals with metal bases. There are also similarly mounted shark figures. The battle takes place on a glossy seascape mapboard. Rules are printed inside the lid.

Name: Vanessa Kay's Pin Up Mania
Description:
From the publisher:
Your favorite Juggy from TV's Man Show!

From the trampoline of TV's Man Show direct to your gaming table, it's our exciting new card game featuring Vanessa Kay.

Race to be the first to complete a Pin Up of Vanessa and win the game. Collect the cards you need to win or block your opponent's play in this fast paced game.


     Two to four players



     Thirty to forty minute playing time



     Be the first to complete a Pin Up of Vanessa and win!

Name: VeggieTales Puzzler
Description:
From the Publisher:

"It's exciting!  It's Baffling! It's VeggieTales Puzzler, the most amazing game you've ever played!  Find 4 cards on the playing grid that form a picture.  Shout "PUZZLE" then take the cards off the grid and flip the timer over.  Correctly arrange the cards to form a picture before time runs out...  it's that simple!"

Name: Take a Hike!
Description:
From the box:

Kids take a hike through the forest in a race to fill their backpacks and reach Camp Fun.  Players choose which animals they want to collect, then move around the board collecting those animals.  The animals stick to the backpacks, then peel off so that they can be used over and over again. Take-a-Hike! is simple enough so that 4 year olds, can quickly learn to play, but interesting enough to hold older kids' attention, too.

This was designed by a five year old, Derek Nelson, the winner of the 1994 National Young Game Inventors contest.

Name: World War II The Expansion
Description:
This expansion for Axis & Allies is designed to add realism, historical accuracy, strategy enhancement, and play balance to the base game.  New elements added to the game include increased production, destroyer escorts, sub patrols, anti-sub patrols, destroyers, cruisers, capital warships, depth charge attacks, wolf packs, air search missions, and more.

Includes: 30 counters.

Expands:

    Axis & Allies

Name: Win, Lose or Draw Junior
Description:
From back of box:
"This simpler Junior version of Win, Lose or Draw is designed for children ages 8 to 11!
  To play, kids pick a card, select a word and call out its category -- People, Places or Things!  The sketching starts!  The guessing begins!  It's a race against time.
  Correct guesses reward both the Sketcher and the Guesser with chips.  Collect enough chips and then guess correctly once more to win!"

Name: World War II Expansion 3: The Battle of Midway
Description:
This is Gamers Paradise's third expansion for Axis & Allies and focuses on the Pacific Theater, adding rules to make the conflict in the Pacific more realistic and interesting.  Includes rules for recreating the bombing of Tokyo by the Doolittle Raid through the historical events that led up to the Battle of Midway in June of 1942. This expansion contains a large 30" x 50" full color heavy duty polypropylene map, the "Midway Scenario" rulebook, and 40 color counters.

Expands:

    Axis & Allies

Name: Räubersprung
Description: Players each get three figures in different colors.  They move their figures along like-colored lines to collect treasure bags, to steal the bags from other players and to change the amount of treasure that will win the game.

Name: 10-Die Poker
Description:
Each player gets a set of 10 dice; 5 of one color, and 5 of another.  Each person rolls his dice in pairs, one of each color, and after rolling all 5 pairs he determines which set of 5 dice of the same color makes a better poker hand.

Most of the standard rules of draw poker apply, including betting.  The key here is that each pair of dice is always rolled together.

For example, if you have 3 of a Kind with your blue dice, and a Pair with your red dice, you might choose to roll two sets of dice (i.e., a blue die and a red one, twice, but ALWAYS rolling the same two dice of each set together throughout the game), hoping for a 4 or 5 of a Kind.  Continuing the example, you might not add to your 3 of a Kind with the blue dice, but maybe you'll pick up a Full House with the red.  No problem -- now you're betting on a Full House.  You can switch back and forth on the hand you're rolling on (blue dice or red), but you must always keep the individual pairs of dice together.
Families: Series: Chief Herman's Next Big Thing

Name: Globall
Description:
This game uses three dice to simulate a soccer match.
Two dice have black letters and sides that say ‘Defense’, ‘Mid-field Play’ and ‘Attack’ (2 of each).  The third die has blue letters and the sides say ‘Mid-field’, ‘Swift Change’, ‘Penalty’, ‘Corner’, ‘Free Kick’ and ‘Goal’.
The dice with black letters relate to the pitch and determine if the attacker may take a shot at goal or not. The die with blue letters is used to take a shot at goal. 
Players take turns rolling the dice and the first player to score 3 goals wins.

Name: Kosherland
Description:
Kosherland is a game designed for very young Jewish children that not only teaches them about colors, learning and following rules, and communication, but also important parts of their religion. The game plays just like the classic Candy Land, with the only real differences being that it has a Kosher food theme and a built-in spinner. Special events on some spaces allow the player to move to different spaces.

As with Candy Land, the first player to reach the end of the board wins.

Name: Temporal Trade
Description: In Temporal Trade, with one of eight scenario's to choose from, the game is begun in the past time frame and players may elect to purchase businesses and improve upon their business with the purchase of business facilities or stores in the past. However when one player lands upon a "Pier" space and meets the conditions required on the pier space, the player may enter in to a path of contiguous spaces leading into the interior of the game board which intersect at a central space entitled the "Temporal Time Ship Space" or time portal wherein the entire game, if that player so chooses, is transported into the future and all costs and expenses automatically change for all players. Of course, a second player, upon arriving at the "Temporal Trade Time Ship Space", may elect to transport the game values back into the past phase tense. The goal is to avoid bankruptcy where in you would be eliminated from the game, but to become the richest or last player who has accumulated the greatest wealth, including the value of businesses, property, and cash on hand over the game playing period.

Name: How to Host a Murder: An Affair to Dismember
Description: A storm rages outside and the Halloween midnight buffet at the Castle Von Morgue is about to commence. Your host Neville Aster-Night is nowhere to be seen. As you all gather in the mourning room, the head servant apprises everyone of her master's murder. As you assume the role of one of these ghoulish characters and solve the mystery, you and your seven dinner guests will enjoy hours of suspense and intrigue. All you need is a sense of humor and a light-hearted approach toward deceit, larceny, sex and murder.

Name: Marvel Heroes Jogo
Description: Heroes and villains of Marvel Comics like Hulk, Wolverine and Magneto fight in an arena. Each player choses a team of two characters - each one gets a pair of unique special powers cards. The movement and the outcome of the battles are decided by the throw of special dice. Two places of the board restore the life points or the special powers of the characters. The first player to knock out all his opponents wins.

Name: Mystical Empire CCG
Description:
Mystical Empire is an Action-Based game, so everything that takes place during the game requires the use of an Action by either a Character or a Creature or a combination of several.

With your Character’s Actions, you may Hire Creatures, Play Items & Structures, or (if able) cast Spells & Effects. Your Character may also Attack once per turn, if you choose, and may save an Action to Defend against Attacks made during your Opponent’s turn.

With your Creature’s Actions, you may Attack your Opponent’s Character or Built Structure(s), Defend against Attacks made by your Opponent’s Character & Creatures, use Special Abilities (which will be written on each card), or (if able) cast Spells & Effects.

Your ultimate goal is to destroy your Opponent’s Character. Once this has been achieved, you win the game.

Name: Alexander's Triumph
Description: A game detailing Alexander's brilliant siege of Tyre in 332 B.C., using the old-school grid movement system.  Includes all relevant land, naval, and siege units, as well as pieces to build Alexander's mole out to the city.
Families: History: Wars of Alexander the Great

Name: Royal
Description: This is a boardgame that uses a regular deck of cards.  Players have pieces representative of the face cards in the deck.  Spot on the board are blank or marked with suits.  Pieces are moved by use of cards (double value with suit matching the player).  Players can send others' pieces back to their start positions, but not if the pieces are sitting on squares of their own suit.

Name: Bao Arabica
Description: Bao Arabica is a modern Kalah game, although for marketing reasons it got an exotic name. The game can be played by 2, 3 or even 4 players, which is rather unusual for Mancala. Moves can be made in either direction, clockwise or counterclockwise. In the two-person variant, each player controls two separate camps, one on each side of the board. The inventor is a co-owner of HiKu games.

Name: Presidents Rummy
Description:
Packed with information, Presidents Rummy teaches children about US Presidents and the eras in which they served. A rummy game is supplemented by numerous variations.

Game includes 50 playing cards (includes 2 blank cards for future Presidents which is handy as the last one is Bill Clinton), 2 directions cards, and 2 additional information cards

Name: Stadsspel
Description:
A series of Monopoly clones about various Swedish cities. Each game has an identical set of rules and components, except for the game board, which is adapted to the city in question.

As in Monopoly, the game is about moving around a board, buying property, drawing cards and paying rent. The object of the game is to eliminate all other players by forcing them into bankruptcy. The players can also agree upon an alternative victory condition before the game begins; the player who owns at least half of all properties is declared the winner.

The game board is covered with advertising. The properties you buy are actually real Swedish companies who reside in the city the game is about.

The big difference from the original Monopoly is the possibility to buy stock. There are five kinds of stock (coffee, coal, iron, oil and gold) with different odds and payout.

Name: D-Code
Description: One player thinks of a word and places letter-tiles face-down on the table.  The other player must guess the word as tiles are revealed.

Name: NATO Vs. Warsaw Pact: 1989
Description: This is a 'what-if' variant on Axis & Allies set in 1989 during the outbreak of a global conflict between NATO and the Warsaw Pact countries.  Player nations include the USSR and China on one side and the USA and NATO on the other, with plenty of neutral countries which may join one side or the other during the course of the game.  Maps, charts, and rules are all provided but you must provide your own playing pieces.

Name: World War II Expansion 2
Description:
This is Gamers Paradise's second expansion for Axis & Allies and is meant to be played both with the original game by Milton Bradley, and the first expansion set by Gamers Paradise. The Pacific Ocean has been enlarged and territory values have been increased to make the Pacific Theater of Operations more interesting and realistic.  This expansion comes with a rulebook and 80 diecut, full color counters for: Artillery, Air Transports, Paratroopers, Carrier-based Aircraft (Zeros and Hellcats), Truck Troop Carriers, German SS Units, British Commando Units, U.S. Marines, Japanese Defensive Fortifications (Pillboxes), and Fighters Unavailable for Flight Duty.

Expands:

    Axis & Allies

Name: Flight Path
Description:
Billed as "the exciting flying race", this game presents a race competition between up to six glider pilots.

From the box: "Your objective, having been launched to 10,000 feet in your glider, is to race across the countryside avoiding all manner of obstacles, hoping not to crash land before you get to the finish."

"Stretching your flying skills to the limit as your competitors place tactical problems in your path, you are forced to search the sky for those much needed thermals to gain valuable height in order to clear the mountain tops and reach the final winning runway."

Name: Wild West War Pigs
Description: The newest in the War PIGs (Plastic Infantry Guys) series, Wild West War PIGs pits plastic Cowboys and Injuns against each other.

Name: Death by Dice
Description: Each player controls a character with six different traits, each represented by a different kind of dice (d6, d8, d4).  Players choose which traits they wish to attack in and the players roll dice for the attack. Twisted little characters duke it out with dice. A fast-paced, strategy dice game played head to head using a combination of character attributes, special abilities, and lots of dice.  (From the website) There are two editions to choose from: Nursery Wars - the gang from the Mother Goose tales gone horribly wrong, includes Ma Goose, Bo Peep, the Mice and One Angry Sheep; and the Gangland Edition, featuring 20s style mobsters such as Knuckles, Malice, and The Shadow. A single game can be played in five minutes, but has a Boss/Minion variation for those who want more dice and strategy options. Each set of Death by Dice includes two character boards and rules. 10 sets in all, dice not included.

Name: Clout: Marvel
Description:
An expansion to Clout Fantasy set in the Marvel Universe.

As of early 2007, this game's release is on indefinite hold.

The Clout range seems to have been discontinued.

Name: Don't Crack
Description: Don't Crack is the game where you are not allowed to laugh smile, smirk, grin, or giggle however it is almost impossible. Imagine if you pick up a card and it says. " Coffee is a natural laxative for me." You had to read it out loud without proofreading. Would that make you laugh? possibly. What if you had to get down on one knee and grab the persons hand to your left and confess your undying love for them. Would that make you laugh? Probably. If anyone laughs during game play they must move back spaces. Two categories are used, " Feel The Part" the acting out a silly situation category and "say It Out Loud" where you just pick up and read it. A game of non stop laughter.

Name: Pick -a- Penguin
Description: Each player chooses to be one of four colored penguins at the South Pole: Yellow, Green, Red or Blue. There are four penguins of each color. All sixteen penguins start out in the center of a rotating iceberg, all mixed up. The penguins are trying to get back to their home igloo. On a player's turn, he rolls the large picture/number die, which will indicate how many penguins may be picked from the iceberg. The player then keeps all of his or her color penguins and returns the other penguins to the iceberg. The player may also roll the die to indicate that the iceberg should be rotated, thus mixing up the memorized order. The first player to bring all of his penguins back home is the winner!

Name: Patriot Act: The Home Version
Description:
Board and mechanics are based on Monopoly.

According to the publisher's website;

PATRIOT ACT: The Home Version, is a game inspired by the historic abuse of governmental powers of the same name. Many of the hypothetical situations in the game are based on real-life events. Either as a game to be played or as a statement to be read, Patriot Act: The Home Version educates the user to the current erosion of our civil rights by the government while claiming to be protecting our freedoms. John Ashcroft may no longer be Attorney General, but his legacy lives on in the anti-freedom legislation that this game is a tribute to.

The game is free and can be downloaded here: http://www.graphix4change.com/portfolio_PA_game.html

Name: Scuba-Opoly
Description: This is the original version of Scuba-Opoly. Play one of your favorite board games with a diving twist. Players collect research dives, trade them for data collection centers, go on treasure hunts and become DAN oxygen instructors.

Name: Wheel of Fortune Game Junior Edition
Description:
From back of box:
"Now younger players can enjoy all the fun and excitement of the popular TV game show anytime, any place in this fast-action home version developed especially for players age 7 to 12!

In Wheel of Fortune Junior Edition, you and your opponents compete to be the first player to solve the phrase hidden on the Puzzle Board -- a famous expression, title, person or thing.  Spin the Wheel and uncover letters to earn money.

If you can avoid going 'Bankrupt' and complete the phrase, you win the round!

After four rounds, the player with the most cash wins the game!"

Name: Art Shark
Description:
Art Shark by Birdcage Press:

You need to be tricky as you bid for artwork, trying to make a fortune.  You switch real artworks for fakes, fooling others into believing which is which.  Outbid the other players at auction for the real ones, and make them bid higher on the fakes...

... and while playing, learn about 64 real art masterpieces!

In this set, there are 64 art cards, 54 chance cards, 2 dice.  Ages 7 to adult.

Name: Double Trouble
Description:
A card game for 2 – 4 players with 60 cards.
The cards have 3 parts: below, in the middle and at the top of the cards.
In every part there is a colored symbol (yellow triangle, violet star, green circle, blue square).
Every card has a number.

At the beginning there are 4 cards on the table.
You have to place one of your cards aside of one of these 4 cards, so that 2 parts are in the same colors. Then the next player.

Name: American Art Ditto
Description:
American Art Ditto by Birdcage Press...

This is a memory card game about American artists.  Match up pairs of art tiles showing works from the greatest American artists.  Collect winnings on 8 art collecting cards that show the beauty and grandeur of life in America -- in the city, on the farm, and in the great outdoors.

48 memory cards and 8 art collecting cards that show art details on one side and full paintings on the other. Ages 4 and up.

Name: Great Art Close up: National Gallery of Art
Description:
Great Art Close Up...

Discover art of the great museums of the world as you play 5 fun card games, including "Memory," "Old Maid," and 2 new matching games for children of different ages. Turn your next visit to the art museum into a treasure hunt with each Close Up deck.

National Gallery of Art Closeup Deck...

Play matching games with this deck of 48 cards featuring masterpieces from the National Gallery. Ages 5 to adult.
Families: Series: Great Art Close Up (Birdcage Press)
Theme: Fine Art and Art Museums

Name: Great Art Close up: The  J. Paul Getty Museum
Description:
Great Art Close Up...

Discover art of the great museums of the world as you play 5 fun card games, including "Memory," "Old Maid," and 2 new matching games for children of different ages. Turn your next visit to the art museum into a treasure hunt with each Close Up deck.

Getty Museum closeup...

Look closely to match close up details to the paintings they come from with this deck of 48 playing cards. Ages 5 to adult.
Families: Series: Great Art Close Up (Birdcage Press)
Theme: Fine Art and Art Museums

Name: Pixelator
Description:
Kid Galaxy, best known for its remote control toys, enters the board game category with the Pixelator, a futuristic strategy board game with an electrobotic module that has a mind of its own.

The Kid Galaxy web site describes Pixelator as "a fascinating new strategy game" that "incorporates a unique, patented 'color recognition' technology."

More from the web site: 
"Drive the Pixelator into your opponents home base to win. Play specially colored cards to maneuver Pixelator. The Pixelator magical all-knowing eye 'sees' the color and moves accordingly."

Pixelator is for 2 players or teams, ages 6 and up.

Name: Controversy!
Description:
(From the web site)

Think you know where your friends stand? You may be surprised. Everyone has an opinion, so here’s your chance to show off yours – pro, con, or “what if?”

Tackle tough issues of the day, like whether men are responsible for putting the toilet seat down, science vs. religion, and Seinfeld vs. Friends.

Tell it like it is – or how you’d like it to be. Air your views and change minds – maybe even your own.

WHO KNEW BEING RIGHT COULD BE SO MUCH FUN?? (tm)

Teens & Adults. 3 or more players.

Name: Great Art Close up: The Museum of Modern Art
Description:
Great Art Close Up...

Discover art of the great museums of the world as you play 5 fun card games, including "Memory," "Old Maid," and 2 new matching games for children of different ages. Turn your next visit to the art museum into a treasure hunt with each Close Up deck.

Moma Closeup deck

Play 5 different games with this deck of 48 museum-quality playing cards featuring great modern artists. Ages 5 to adult.
Families: Series: Great Art Close Up (Birdcage Press)
Theme: Fine Art and Art Museums

Name: Old Dinosaur
Description:
(from the web site)

WATCH OUT FOR T-REX! Discover the world of dinosaurs as you play three favorite card games: "Old Maid," "Go Fish," and "Concentration."

Discover:

- Which flesh-eating dinosaur was even bigger than T-Rex?
- Which dinosaurs had feathers but could not fly? 
- Who was a "missing link" between dinosaurs and birds?

Learn a little French as you play different card games. The cards have dinosaur descriptions in both English and French. They also give each dinosaur's Latin name and how to pronounce it, and show you how big each dinosaur was.

47 playing cards and a dinosaur guide come in a fun tin box. Ages 5 and up.

Name: Art Ditto
Description:
Art Ditto from Birdcage Press...

In Art Ditto, you will to play memory games with great works of art, as you collect art collecting cards.  Playing the game enables you to learn how different artists depict birds, boats, cats, flowers, horses, and more.  Players will also learn words in four languages as they have fun with great art.

The game contains 48 memory tiles, 8 art collecting cards, and instructions in English, French, Spanish and German. Ages 4 and up.

Name: Renaissance Go Fish for Art
Description:
(from the web site)

Go Fish for Great Art!

Learn about great art as you play "Go Fish" and "Concentration" card games. Use strategy and memory to collect all the works of art by each artist. You don't need to know about art to win the game and you learn a lot as you play.

All 3 Go Fish for Art games are winners of a Parents' Choice Gold Medal.

Renaissance Go Fish for Art:

A deck of 30 museum-quality playing cards and a guide to the artists. Ages 7 to adult.

Name: Van Gogh & Friends Go Fish for Art
Description:
(from the web site)

Go Fish for Great Art!

Learn about great art as you play "Go Fish" and "Concentration" card games. Use strategy and memory to collect all the works of art by each artist. You don't need to know about art to win the game and you learn a lot as you play.

All 3 Go Fish for Art games are winners of a Parents' Choice Gold Medal.

Van Gogh & Friends Go Fish for Art:

A deck of 36 museum-quality playing cards and a guide to the artists. Ages 7 to adult.

Name: Impressionist Go Fish for Art
Description:
(from the web site)

Go Fish for Great Art!

Learn about great art as you play "Go Fish" and "Concentration" card games. Use strategy and memory to collect all the works of art by each artist. You don't need to know about art to win the game and you learn a lot as you play.

All 3 Go Fish for Art games are winners of a Parents' Choice Gold Medal.

Impressionist Go Fish for Art:

A deck of 32 museum-quality playing cards and a guide to the artists. Ages 7 to adult.

Name: American Idol All-Star Challenge DVD Game
Description:
from the web site

Experience all the excitement of American Idol as you journey from Auditions, to Hollywood and onward to the Finals round of competition. With real television clips from the first four seasons, plus show questions and performance challenges, American Idol – All Star Challenge will transform your living room into the ultimate TV talent showdown. Test your Idol knowledge as you relive all the trials and tribulations, the victories and the heartbreaks that have made American Idol one of the hottest shows on television today.

Name: Moby Dick: Das Spiel vom weißen Wal
Description:
(the german subtitle means: The game of the white whale)

An early oddity in the Ravensburger program: The game consists of an elevated round course with an underlying rotating cardboard disk - on their turn the players rotate the disk. Whenever a whale symbol appears, a small plastic whale miniature is put on the course.
The players now try to catch the whale with their ships (= reach the whale miniature), before it dives again (a hole in the rotating disk lets the miniature disappear into the game box).
The rotating disk also constantly changes the values for different whaling goods at a stock exchange. The player selling his cargo for the highest price wins. 
Sometimes a white (plastic) whale appears which cannot be caught, but the player "wounding" Moby Dick gets a gold doubloon worth 200 $.

Name: Vis Magica
Description:
From the publisher's website

Rules for Fantasy Wargaming!

Fantasy wargaming system based on the popular Vis Bellica rules for Ancient & Medieval wargaming.

Figures based as chunky elements that correctly represent ground scale.  Easy to move round the table and look good.

An average game consists of about 120 figures a side, and takes about 2½-3 hours of play to resolve.

A combat system that doesn’t involve complicated book-keeping or rolling more than two or three dice at a time.

A command structure where figures are grouped as regular ‘brigades’ or irregular ‘contingents’ that report to officers that report to more senior officers.

A command system where officers could, on a parade ground, successfully issue a limited set of orders to the figures under their command, but this ability breaks down rapidly as the 'fog of war' descends during a battle.   
 Hidden movement possible without the need for a referee.

An army list philosophy that allows you to use any figures from any manufacturer:  to use your imagination!

Name: Vis Bellica
Description:
From the publisher's website

Rules for Wargaming the Ancient Period

Figures based as chunky elements that correctly represent both ground scale and historical (as far as is known) units.  Easy to move round the table and look good.

An average game consists of about 120 figures a side, and takes about 2½-3 hours of play to resolve.

A combat system that doesn’t involve complicated book-keeping or rolling more than two or three dice at a time.

A command structure where figures are grouped as regular ‘brigades’ or irregular ‘contingents’ that report to officers that report to more senior officers.

A command system where officers could, on a parade ground, successfully issue a limited set of orders to the figures under their command, but this ability breaks down rapidly as the 'fog of war' descends during a battle.   
 
Hidden movement possible without the need for a referee.

Army lists that emphasize the common soldier as opposed to being a collection of special units grouped together

Name: Gallop Home
Description:
From the box: "Train your horse and win! Have you ever wanted to train your own horse? Now you can with the game Gallop Home! Travel around the board in this exciting, fun filled, educational game that will take your imagination into the horse world."

Each player chooses one of four horses, each having a corresponding game pad and a plastic, molded horse-head movement token. The game pad lists the training goals of each horse type; for example, the Arabian's most important training is pleasure, then, in sequence, halter, endurance, dressage, reining, driving, racing, trick riding, jumping, and barrels. Other horses emphasize different training schedules.
Players roll and move around the board, attempting to participate in the training most important to their horses. They also gather bonuses for proper care of their horses; for example, a stop at the vet scores points. The winner isn't necessarily the one to get to the end of the game board first, but to have accumulated the most points for training and care.

Name: Topsy Turtle
Description:
From the box:

Help this musical, talking turtle get out of the pond! Listen and Topsy Turtle will tell you what color block to place under his toes. Higher! Higher! Be the first player to use up all your blocks and you win. Be careful! If he topples, you get all the blocks back.

From the instructions:

Electronic Talking Topsy Turtle
24 Color Blocks
4 Turtle Legs
Pond Gameboard

Requires 4 x 1.5 volt AA batteries (not included)

Name: Royale Mastermind
Description: Royale Mastermind is a variant of Mastermind where two players solve 8 patterns, alternating between being the knower and the guesser.  Shapes and colors are guessed independently on each side of the board.  The total number of guesses each player requires to solve the color/shape pattern is tallied, the winner being the one to take the fewest guesses.  The patterns consist of three elements, each having one of five shapes and one of five colors.  A deck of 25 cards is used to establish the pattern, and after each card is used in a puzzle, it is not used again.  The corresponding shape/color is also covered on a grid in the center of the board so the players can use this information in future rounds.

Name: Beat the Count
Description:
(from the web site)

Knock out your opponent and be the first to play ll of your cards successfully. Go ahead, "Beat The Count!"

Ages: 8 and up
Players: 3 to 8 players
Contents: 112 number and action cards and instructions

Name: Across Words
Description: The Electronic Talking Word Race Game! A rousing, high-fiving, laugh provoking, quick-thinking, adrenaline rush of a game! Players race to make the word that solves the clue. The talking "emcee" sets a lively pace from start to finish.

Name: Sackers
Description:
From the Publisher's web site:

Addictive game combining horseshoes and shuffleboard. Great for the beach, picnics, tailgate parties or even your own backyard.

Aim for year-round fun with our indoor/outdoor action game. Earn points when beanbags go through the hole or remain on the board at the end of your turn. But watch out… your opponents’ beanbags may knock yours off the board! Sackers combines the fun of horseshoes and shuffleboard in a game that’s safe, portable and addictively fun!

For 2 Players or Teams

No. 8000
Ages 8 & Up

Name: Slap Dragon
Description:
Another in the Patch Products' series of "Big Deal" card games...

From the Publisher's web site:

Slap the Dragon! Slap him fast! Slap again when the pictures match! Simply put, those are all the rules in this adorable picture identifying and matching game for the little ones! No reading required.

Instructions in English and Spanish.

For 2 Players

No. 6627
Ages 4 and up

Name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Anthropology
Description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

ANTHROPOLOGY: The excavation has taken months, but it's been worth it. Brushing away the ancient dust, you find an excellent collection of stone-age pottery shards with terrible lizards carved in them. They all laughed in school, but you always knew you'd find the missing link between cavemen and dinosaurs!

Name: Venturers in Argent
Description:
Taken from the games website:
Venturers in Argent is a fantasy boardgame set in the World of Argent.  It is a cooperative game in which as many as five players can participate, or as few as one (thus it is suitable for solitaire play).  The players take on the parts of venturers, who set out to find treasure on a dangerous enterprise called a venture.  The game can be played as a single venture in one session, or as a campaign of several ventures, with the power and abilities of the venturers increasing as they prepare for their final objective: the stronghold of the Silent Mountain … and the One Who Waits.

Name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Chemistry
Description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

CHEMISTRY: Since the dawn of time, humans have wielded influence over their surroundings. Ages of struggle and research into nature's elements have brought a deep wisdom. We have since learned that we cannot use lye to convert lead to gold. So we want you to do it.

Name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Astronomy
Description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

ASTRONOMY: Getting tired of your everyday mind-control devices and rampaging mutants? Does the thought of making yet another mundane machine lack luster? Ever think that blowing up planets might be fun? Why not develop a Space Wars program? Fully government funded, Mad Scientist University is the premier place to launch those dreams!

Name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Computers
Description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

COMPUTERS: You will be integrated into the Mad Scientist University Computer Program. Compliance is mandatory. Primary objective: Translate everything into binary. Get your mice working

Name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Dorm Life
Description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

DORM LIFE: Overpriced living. Cramped quarters. Unsanitary conditions. Strange roommates. All this can be yours, at Mad Scientist University's on-campus living! We have: Communal showers, to bring the community together. A meal plan, because we know mad scientists forget to eat. Plenty of spare vermin, in case you need cheap experiment subjects or just forgot to feed your snake. Sign up for your cell today!

Name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Greek Life
Description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

GREEK LIFE: We here at Mad Scientist University have a long and honorable tradition of study, service, and something else. The Greek Life at Mad Scientist University strives to be that something else... with togas, funnels, and donkeys, we want to fill that space in your life. We want to create a new race, not just as an extra credit project for your Anthropology project, but as a way of life. Do you think you can handle it?

Name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Physical Education
Description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

PHYSICAL EDUCATION: In an ordinary university, you’d be lifting medicine balls. Here at U. Mad Scientist, we do something similar, but by ‘medicine balls’ we mean ‘octopi’, and by ‘lifting’ we mean ‘forming a conga line with.’ Your opponent’s basketball team has eight legs to a man… to get your team to win, you’ll need lots of peanut butter.

Expands:

    Mad Scientist University

Name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Medicine
Description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

MEDICINE: It was a dark and stormy night. Thunder crashed above. Deep in the laboratory at Mad Scientist University's School of Medicine, the doctor unwrapped the bandages. The assistant shuddered at the gruesome sight and asked, "Do you really think you can get your insurance to pay for it?"

Expands:

    Mad Scientist University

Name: Mad Scientist University Course Packet: Physics
Description:
Course Packs add 50 new cards from a specific discipline to the Mad Scientist University core game.

From the publisher:

PHYSICS: Your current assignment is to become incorporeal. The Physics department is doing experiments on how to walk through walls and survive impacts. With enough depleted uranium, you would have no problem making someone incorporeal, but you haven't quite figured out how to keep your test subjects alive...

Expands:

    Mad Scientist University

Name: Super Tank I
Description:
Super Tank I is an expansion to SPI's Tank! Armored Combat in the 20th Century game.  Super Tank is more than just an expansion of SPI's game, however, it is a complete revision of the infantry rules.  Armored Vehicle rules are mostly in SPIs's rules folders for Tank.  The infantry in Super Tank are played sequentially while the vehicle and gun units remain simultaneous.  This makes large numbers of infantry easier to game...

The hexes on the large map are one inch to allow play with 1/285 miniatures.

The player will find that he has all the units he needs for all WWII types of attack and defense, including cavalry, machine guns, mortars, bridge laying AFV, rocket launchers and many other new types of units.  Super tank is truly a combined arms game.

Game components include one 34" by 54" map (!) two mini 11" by 17" plotting maps, two Terrain and combat tables, eight (!) 11" by 14" die cut counter sheets (448 infantry, 960 Armored Vehicles) one booklet of rules, and three zip Lock bags.

Game includes just about every tank made by anyone in WWII, each unit rated for Front, Side and Rear armor, as well as AP/HE factors, Range and Movement.  An awesome game!

Expands:

    Tank! Armored Combat in the 20th Century
